TITLE: Fed sees interest rate hikes continuing until inflation eases substantially, minutes show
SUMMARY: The FOMC on Wednesday released minutes from its July 26-27 meeting, when it raised interest rates by 0.75 percentage point.

TITLE: The world's largest sovereign wealth fund loses $174 billion in the first half, cites inflation and war in Europe
SUMMARY: The $1.3 trillion fund returned a negative 14.4% during the period, as stocks and bonds reacted violently to global recession fears and skyrocketing inflation.

TITLE: UK inflation hits new 40-year high of 10.1% as food and energy price surge continues
SUMMARY: U.K. inflation rose to another 40-year high in July as spiraling food and energy prices continued to intensify the country's historic squeeze on households.

TITLE: Tencent, the $370 billion Chinese tech giant, posts first ever revenue decline
SUMMARY: Tencent posted its first ever quarterly year-on-year revenue decline as stricter regulations around gaming in China and a resurgence of Covid hit the tech giant.

TITLE: Drought conditions in Britain prompt water restrictions for millions in London
SUMMARY: The Temporary Use Ban is set to come into effect from August 24.

TITLE: Crypto broker Genesis slashes 20% of workforce and announces CEO exit after loans soured
SUMMARY: Genesis CEO Michael Moro is leaving and the company is cutting jobs after losing money from loans to bankrupt hedge fund Three Arrows Capital.

TITLE: Monkeypox cases jumped 20% in the last week to 35,000 across 92 countries, WHO says
SUMMARY: Nearly all cases are reported in Europe and the Americas among men who have sex with men, according to the WHO.

TITLE: 'Avatar,' Spider-Man and Star Wars return to the big screen as summer box office winds down
SUMMARY: Disney and Sony are rereleasing "Rogue One," "Spider-Man: No Way Home" and "Avatar" in domestic theaters in the coming weeks.

TITLE: Manchester United shares briefly pop 17% in premarket after Elon Musk jokes about buying the club
SUMMARY: Shares of the English soccer club Manchester United Plc briefly rose by as much as 17% in premarket trading on Wednesday.

TITLE: OPEC not to blame for soaring inflation, new chief says, citing underinvestment in oil and gas
SUMMARY: New OPEC Secretary-General Haitham Al Ghais said Wednesday that the influential producer group is not to blame for soaring inflation.

TITLE: 'Boomerang' employees are back in force. Why you should — or shouldn’t — try to get your old job back
SUMMARY: Did you quit your job during the pandemic and now hope to get it back? CNBC Make It finds out the pros and cons of doing so.

TITLE: A high-profile meeting in China may have tipped off which provinces will have highest growth
SUMMARY: Chinese Premier Li Keqiang has called on six provinces to take the lead in supporting the country's growth after July data showed a slowdown across the board.

TITLE: Wall Street analysts are betting on another red-hot commodity rally before year-end
SUMMARY: Commodities have broadly pulled back from their recent peaks, but Wall Street analysts say the fundamentals are pointing to another rally by year-end.

TITLE: China needs Taiwan's biggest chipmaker — more than the other way around
SUMMARY: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company has limited revenue and manufacturing exposure to mainland China, while dominating the world's advanced chip tech.

TITLE: Japanese support for a nuclear restart is at its highest since Fukushima disaster, says former IEA executive director
SUMMARY: It's the first time since the disaster that public support for a nuclear restart is over 60%, said Nobuo Tanaka, citing a possible energy crunch as a reason.

TITLE: Biden signs Inflation Reduction Act into law, setting 15% minimum corporate tax rate
SUMMARY: After more than a year of debate, Biden's sweeping infrastructure bill is became law — albeit a significantly smaller version of his Build Back Better plan.

TITLE: BlackRock makes $700 million investment in Australian battery storage
SUMMARY: BlackRock says Akaysha has plans to develop energy storage projects in a range of Asia-Pacific markets.

TITLE: Apple and Meta headsets could face a big challenge: Sticker shock
SUMMARY: Apple and Meta are developing technology for mixed reality that requires a lot of expensive parts and a powerful headset.

TITLE: Looking for an offbeat European holiday? This island has its own rules, language and vodka
SUMMARY: Accessible via ferry or flight, Jersey has nearly 50 miles of coastline, more sunshine than mainland U.K. and plenty for travelers to do in the Channel Islands.

TITLE: Bed Bath & Beyond soars as much as 70% as meme traders talk up Ryan Cohen's call options purchase
SUMMARY: Bed Bath & Beyond jumped as meme stock traders piled in, encouraged by GameStop Chairman Ryan Cohen placing another bet on the struggling retailer.

TITLE: Dodge's first electrified vehicle will be a new crossover called the Hornet
SUMMARY: The first electrified vehicle for Stellantis' Dodge brand will be a plug-in hybrid crossover called the Hornet, a resurrected name of a 1970s station wagon.

TITLE: Jim Cramer warns investors not to bet prematurely on a soft landing
SUMMARY: Jim Cramer issued a warning to fair-weather bulls on Tuesday's episode of "Mad Money."

TITLE: Homebuyers are backing out of more deals as high mortgage rates persist and recession fears linger
SUMMARY: Homebuilder cancellation rates have more than doubled since April, according to surveys by John Burns Real Estate Consulting.

TITLE: China’s $370 billion tech giant Tencent could post its first revenue decline on record
SUMMARY: A Covid-induced slowdown in the Chinese economy and continued challenges in the domestic gaming market could prove strong headwinds for Tencent.

TITLE: U.S. Navy is seeing more 'unsafe' aerial intercepts by China, says Seventh Fleet commander
SUMMARY: Karl Thomas said on Tuesday that he's seen a increase in "unsafe" aerial intercepts by Chinese military in the South China Sea region.

TITLE: Salman Rushdie's 'The Satanic Verses' leaps to top of Amazon bestseller lists
SUMMARY: The author's "The Satanic Verses" topped several Amazon's bestselling book lists on Tuesday, days after he sustained serious injuries in a stabbing.

TITLE: Walmart sticks with second-half outlook after earnings beat expectations
SUMMARY: The retailer's profits are under pressure, as consumers feel pinched by inflation and buy fewer high-margin items, such as apparel and electronics.

TITLE: Chinese food delivery giant Meituan tanks 9% after Tencent reportedly plans to divest $24 billion stake
SUMMARY: Tencent, which owns 17% of Meituan, is planning to placate domestic regulators and cash in on its eight-year-old investment, Reuters reported.

TITLE: American Airlines agrees to buy 20 supersonic planes from Boom
SUMMARY: American Airlines has agreed to purchase 20 supersonic Overture planes from Boom Supersonic, the second firm order for Boom in the last two years.

TITLE: 'How do I know if I was vaccinated for polio?' and other trending questions about the virus, answered by a doctor
SUMMARY: The first U.S. polio case since 2013 was detected last month. A doctor answers 'Was I vaccinated for polio?' and other urgent questions about the virus.
